SETTING.LABEL: Camera settings
SETTING.st_CameraAutorunIntervalSetting_descript: Interval to check if camera is offline and 'AutoRun' is on and try rerun camera

DESCRIPTION.motionThreshold: Enable/Disable the motion alarm and control the sensitivity.
DESCRIPTION.gotoPreset: ONVIF cameras that can move only. Will cause the camera to move to a preset location.
DESCRIPTION.textOverlay: Dahua, Instar and Hikvision can overlay any text you enter here over the video stream.
DESCRIPTION.enableLED: Turn the IR LED ON or OFF. Some cameras have 3 states the LED can be in, so see the autoLED channel.
DESCRIPTION.autoLED: When ON this sets a cameras IR LED to automatically turn on or off.
DESCRIPTION.audioThreshold: By moving this control you should be able to change how sensitive the audio alarm is to soft or loud noises.
DESCRIPTION.enableAudioAlarm: Allows the audio alarm to be turned ON or OFF.
DESCRIPTION.enableLineCrossingAlarm: Turns the line crossing alarm for API cameras, ON and OFF.
DESCRIPTION.enableMotionAlarm: Turns the motion alarm ON and OFF for API cameras. This will not effect FFmpeg based alarms which have their own control.
DESCRIPTION.enablePrivacyMode: Enable or disable the Privacy Mode of newer Amcrest/Dahua cameras. The camera will move the lens way down and stop the stream.
DESCRIPTION.externalLight: Some cameras have a dedicated relay output for turning lights on and off with.
DESCRIPTION.enableExternalAlarmInput: Hikvision and Instar allow the Alarm input terminals to be disabled by this control.
DESCRIPTION.triggerExternalAlarmInput: Hikvision cameras can change if the alarm input terminal is ON when high or low. This can be used to manually cause an alarm input event to occur.
DESCRIPTION.enablePirAlarm: Turn PIR sensor ON or OFF.
DESCRIPTION.enableFieldDetectionAlarm: Allows the field detection alarm to be turned ON or OFF. Some cameras will call this the Intrusion Alarm.

help.snapshotPollInterval: Specify interval for taking snapshots for snapshots.mjpeg
help.segmentTime: Set segment duration to time in sec., the value must be a duration specification
help.selectStream: Choose which streams from the input(s) should be included in the output(s)
help.motionThreshold: Enable/Disable the motion alarm and control the sensitivity.
help.hlsListSize: Set the maximum number of playlist entries. If set to 0 the list file will contain all the segments.
help.cameraIpAddress: The IP address or host name of your camera.
help.onvifPort: The port your camera uses for ONVIF connections. This is needed for PTZ movement, events, and the auto discovery of RTSP and snapshot URLs.
help.cameraServerPort: The port that will serve the video streams and snapshots back to openHAB without authentication. You can choose any number, but it must be unique and unused for each camera that you setup. Setting the port to -1 (default), will turn all file serving off and some features will fail to work.
help.cameraUsername: Leave blank if your camera does not use login details.
help.cameraPassword: Leave blank if your camera does not use login details.
help.onvifMediaProfile: 0 (default) is your cameras Mainstream and the numbers above 0 are the substreams. Any auto discovered URLs will use the streams that this indicates. You can always override the URLs should you wish to use something different for one of them.
help.nvrChannel: Set this to 1 (default) if it is a standalone camera, or to the input channel number of your NVR that the camera is connected to. This effects the hard coded URLs for the API based cameras.
help.snapshotUrl: Leave this empty to auto detect the snapshot URL if the camera has ONVIF, or enter a HTTP address if you wish to override with a different address. Setting this to ffmpeg forces the camera to use FFmpeg to create the snapshots from the RTSP stream.
help.alarmInputUrl: A URL you can use for the FFmpeg created Audio and Motion Alarms as they don't require high res feeds as they are not seen.
help.customMotionAlarmUrl: Foscam only, for custom enable motion alarm use. More info found in Foscam's setup steps.
help.customAudioAlarmUrl: Foscam only, for custom enable audio alarm use. More info found in Foscam's setup steps.
help.mjpegUrl: A HTTP URL for MJPEG format streams. If you enter 'ffmpeg' the stream can be generated from the RTSP URL.
help.ffmpegInput: Best if this stream is in H.264 format and can be RTSP or HTTP URLs. Leave this blank to use the auto detected RTSP address for ONVIF cameras.
help.ffmpegInputOptions: Allows you to specify any options before the -i on the commands for FFmpeg. If you have a ESP32 camera that only has a mjpeg stream then make this equal -f mjpeg.
help.hlsOutOptions: This gives you direct access to specify your own FFmpeg options to be used. Default: -strict -2 -f lavfi -i aevalsrc=0 -acodec aac -vcodec copy -hls_flags delete_segments -hls_time 2 -hls_list_size 4
help.gifOutOptions: This gives you direct access to specify your own FFmpeg options to be used for animated GIF files. Default: -r 2 -filter_complex scale=-2:360:flags=lanczos,setpts=0.5*PTS,split[o1][o2];[o1]palettegen[p];[o2]fifo[o3];[o3][p]paletteuse
help.mjpegOutOptions: Allows you to change the settings for creating a MJPEG stream from RTSP using FFmpeg. Possible reasons to change this would be to rotate or re-scale the picture from the camera, change the JPG compression for better quality or the FPS rate.
help.snapshotOutOptions: Specify your own FFmpeg options to be used when creating snapshots from RTSP. Default: -an -vsync vfr -q:v 2 -update 1
help.motionOptions: This gives access to the FFmpeg parameters for detecting motion alarms from a RTSP stream. One possible use for this is to use the CROP feature to ignore any trees that move in the wind or a timecode stamp. Crop will not remove the trees from your picture, it only ignores the movement of the tree.
help.ptzContinuous: If set to false (default) the camera will move using Relative commands, If set to true the camera will instead use continuous movements and will require an OFF command to stop the movement.
